Class CsvQuery2HtmlTableOperation

java.lang.Object

                      gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.operations.CsvQuery2HtmlTableOperation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operation, Worker
public class CsvQuery2HtmlTableOperation
extends QueryPrinterOperation<CsvRecord,CsvRecordQuery>

Converts a CsvRecord to an HTML file with a table. The operation takes as input a CSV file stream and a stream that contains the CSS file for the output HTML file. The CSS will be included in the output file.

Constructor Detail

CsvQuery2HtmlTableOperation

public CsvQuery2HtmlTableOperation(int columnCount,
                                   char separator,
                                   String streamsBasicName)
Creates a new CsvQuery2HtmlTableOperation object.

Parameters:
columnCount - Count of CSV file columns.
separator - Column separator in the CSV file.
streamsBasicName - Base for the logical name of the streams. The logical name of the streams used by this operation are created with the addition of an extension to this basic name.
The extension csv is added in order to create the input CSV file logical name.
The extension css is added in order to create the logical name of the input CSS file that contains the style sheet information.
The extension properties is added in order to create the logical name of the properties file that keets the attributes of the HTML table.
Method Detail

init

public void init(Provider parent)
          throws InitializationException
Description copied from interface: Worker
Introduces the runtime context (environment) to the worker. The parent provides the runtime context. The runtime context can be anything that facilitates access to any back-end system (Databases, Files, Application Server etc).
Different implementations of Worker, will require from their parent provider resources of different types. Sub-interfaces of Provider can provide resources of any type. The implementations of worker must get the specific sub-type of Provider by their parent by calling the method parent.getProvider(subclass) where subclass is the sub-interface of Provider that is required.

Specified by:
init in interface Worker
Overrides:
init in class QueryPrinterOperation<CsvRecord,CsvRecordQuery>
Parameters:
parent - The runtime provider
Throws:
InitializationException - When the parent fails to provide the resources required by the worker.

setManagerName

public void setManagerName(String managerName)
Description copied from class: AbstractResourceConsumer
Sets the name of the ResourceWrapper manager that will provide this worker with the appropriate resources. This method is provided, in order to support a case, where an AbstractResourceConsumer needs to set the resource manager name to some of its children.

Overrides:
setManagerName in class AbstractResourceConsumer
Parameters:
managerName - The managerName to set.
